title: The CEO of Walmart says 3 things separate out future CEOs from the rest
text:
Doug McMillon is the president and CEO of Walmart. He knows how to work his way to the top.

For people trying to get to his position, he said there's three tips that can help them move forward.

Mastering the job you have, helping others, and taking on extra, harder assignments are all crucial to moving up.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

Becoming the CEO of a billion-dollar organization starts with these three steps.

Walmart president and CEO Doug McMillon know a thing or two about rising to the top.

McMillon, 52, became Walmart's fifth CEO in 2014, heading the company that was valued at $386 billion in 2018, according to GOBankingRates. He previously headed Walmart's international division and was the CEO of Sam's Club.

McMillon said multiple associates told him that they wanted his job one day in a recent post on LinkedIn. So, the Walmart CEO decided to write up a few tips on how people can move forward in their careers — and it all happens with hard work.
